originalText.text: My partner and i were fortunate enough to try this chef‚Äôs amazing food at Smorgasburg in Brooklyn last year and we can‚Äôt wait to go back! Everything was absolutely incredible, you could really taste the love in the food. We got the jackfruit chicharrones with mofongo, the alcapurrias, and guava and cheese empanada. We loved her food so much that we pre-ordered her cookbook as soon as it came out! Def gotta take a trip over to see her again soon!

originalText.text: I have been supporting this business for years. I‚Äôm leaving a review because it has come to my attention that someone is leaving negative reviews to hurt a business I love dearly. Lyana, the owner is a true pioneer in the Afro Latina Community. Her work and brand speaks for itself. (Google her) She has created an entire genre of food, and never forgot about her people along the way. Supporting a business for the food is one thing, but I choose to support this business because SHE and her staff, are apart of my community. She employs people, she stays true to her roots and she does so with grace. I hope that if your reading this you get to experience her business and her light. The only thing I wish is that she was able to have a restaurant already so I can order at my leisure! Oh, and try the chopped cheese egg rolls. Game changing! #Teamblackricanveganforever

originalText.text:
The menu confused me, chopped cheese no egg roll‚Ä¶ I thought ‚Äúwhat!? I wanted the egg roll so now you only have a chopped cheese sandwich ?‚Äù She was ‚ÄúNOoooooo Herald, it is an egg roll but without egg‚Äù I ordered it and moved on ‚Ä¶. It wasn‚Äôt bad for vegan food.

I wanted to wash things down with a drink and I saw the 6$ moxtail (jackfruit) and assumed it must be a very tasty cocktail üçπ, it was not, it is a simple stuffed empanada that doesn‚Äôt add much to her menu, she should replace it with her lentil patty üíØ. There are some holes in your naming conventions game.

This place is overhyped, it is good, but not great, it‚Äôs greasy vegan street food.

originalText.text: As an organizer of events for our locals in the Bronx providing a top vegan chef in our community is a priority. BRV has always exceeded the standards of ethical partnership. She shows up earlier than other vendors, stays up all night taking a gamble on turn out on numbers, provides food, desserts & drinks, brings a beat face, has well done branding.. I can go on. She‚Äôs reliable, authentic CONSISTENT, and passionate about her business. The food is truly the cherry on top. The dedication in delivering the assorted flavors and culture through her food is noticeable. Thank you BlackRicanVegan for providing that heartfelt commitment through your cuisine. We‚Äôre grateful to have u at our experiences.

originalText.text: I discovered Lyana on IG, I was instantly drawn in by the pics of her food. I saw the lines get crazy, so make sure to get there hours before she even opens(I‚Äôve seen ppl bring chairs). But on the weekends she does pick up and deliveries..Now the foodüò©üò© omg I can go on and on about how delicious her food is! I‚Äôm happy she‚Äôs offering the community this. I love telling everyone I know about BlackRicanVegan, especially people who‚Äôve never tried vegan dishes.
